00007 =head1 NAME
00008 
00009 PGanalyzeGraph.pl
00010 
00011 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00012 
00013 These routines support the
00014 analysis of  graphical input from students.
00015 
00016 =cut
00017 
00018 
00019 =head4  detect_intervals
00020 
00021 
00022 
00023    input:   $pointDisplayString 
00024          
00025    return: (\@combined_intervals, \@values)
00026            @values contains the y values of the function in order
00027            @combined_intervals contains anonymous arrays of the form
00028                [ $slope, $left_x, $right_x]  indicating the gradient on that segment.
00029                successive intervals will have different slopes.
00030                
00031 
00032 =cut
00033 
00034 
00035 
00036 sub detect_intervals {
00037     my $pointDisplayString = shift;
00038     my @intervals;
00039     my @combined_intervals=();
00040     my @points;
00041     my @values;
00042     $out_string ='';
00043     return "" unless defined $pointDisplayString and $pointDisplayString =~/\S/;
00044     @pointDisplayLines = split("\n",$pointDisplayString);
00045     #drop first line
00046     #shift @pointDisplayLines;
00047     my ($prev_x, $prev_y, $prev_yp) = (undef);
00048     my $slope;
00049     
00050     #first calculate the average gradient on each interval
00051     
00052     foreach my $line (@pointDisplayLines) {
00053         chomp($line);
00054         next unless $line =~/\S/;  # skip blank lines
00055         ($x,$y,$yp) = split(/\s+/, $line);
00056 
00057         if (defined $prev_x) {
00058              $slope = $y - $prev_y;
00059             
00060             if ($slope >0) {
00061                 $slope_str="increasing";
00062             } elsif ($slope <0) {
00063                 $slope_str="decreasing";
00064             } else {
00065                 $slope_str = "constant";
00066             }
00067             push @intervals, [$slope_str, $prev_x, $x];  
00068             
00069             #TEXT("f is $slope_str on the interval [$prev_x, $x]$BR");
00070         }
00071         #TEXT("x=$x y = $y yp = $yp $BR");
00072         push @points, [$x, $y, $yp];
00073         push @values, $y; 
00074         $prev_x =$x; $prev_y=$y; $prev_yp = $yp;
00075         
00076     }
00077     my $prev_slope = undef;
00078     my ($left_x, $right_x);
00079     
00080     ########
00081     # Combine adjacent intervals with the same properites
00082     ########
00083     foreach my $item (@intervals) {
00084         if (defined $prev_slope) {
00085             if ($prev_slope eq $item->[0]) {
00086                 $right_x = $item->[2];          
00087             } else {
00088                 push @combined_intervals, [$prev_slope, $left_x, $right_x];
00089                 $left_x = $item->[1];
00090                 $right_x = $item->[2];
00091             }
00092         
00093         } else {
00094             $left_x = $item->[1];
00095             $right_x = $item->[2];
00096         }
00097         $prev_slope = $item->[0]; 
00098         # warn "intervals",join(" ", @combined_intervals);
00099     }
00100     push @combined_intervals, [$prev_slope, $left_x, $right_x];
00101     
00102   (\@combined_intervals, \@values);
00103 }
